result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
2:53 PM Defendant FRANK W THOMAS in court.  Prosecuting attorney Laura Nelson in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant qualifies for PD services but is awaiting appointment.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for January 24, 2023 at 01:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on January 24, 2023 at 01:30 pm.

2:19 PM Defendant FRANK W THOMAS in court.  Attorney Gregory A. Parker in court for State of Wisconsin. Public defender office still looking for counsel to appoint.  Defendant requests bond modification.  State requests motion to be filed. Bond remains in effect.
Status conference scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on October 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Notice of hearing (NOH)- given to Defendant in Court.

10:02 am. Prosecuting Attorney Joseph J. Kaupie in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant FRANK W THOMAS in court. The Court addresses the Defendant. Court gives the Defendant two choices in regards to todays PH. 1) waive right to an atty. for todays PH and hold the PH today. 2) waive the time limits for holding a PH and wait for an atty. to be appointed. Defendant addresses the Court - picks option 2. Court accepts the waiver of time limits for PH. STC to be set for atty. status.
Status conference scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
